document.docAuthor: Couri, Marcia S., Pont, Adrian C. & Daugeron, Christophe

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Limnophora mesolissa Bezzi, 1928: 175
. Lectotype male, Taviuni, Fiji , in BMNH, des.
Pont (1970: 429)
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Small species, body length 2.4–4.5 mm; male frons broad, about one-third of head-width; frontal triangle shining black; arista subplumose; halter yellow; 4 postsutural dorsocentral setae; scutum dark brown, sometimes, especially in female, with a narrow silver band in front of the suture, interrupted in middle, and another one in front of the scutellum, more developed in female; abdomen dark brown, grey dusted, abdominal tergites 3 and 4 with two broad lateral triangular marks.

Comments. Malloch (1929b) keyed the species together with the other species of
Limnophora
occurring in the Society Islands ( French Polynesia ) and drew attention to the diagnostically important wide frons of the male, which is equally broad in both sexes. According to present knowledge, the species is known only from the Australasian/Oceanian Regions.
The large series shows variation in size, with specimens ranging from 2.5 to 4.5 mm. Males are always much smaller than females.

Distribution. American Samoa , Australia (NT, Qld), Belau , Fiji , French Polynesia (Society Is), Guam , Indonesia ( Maluku ), Lord Howe I, Micronesia , New Caledonia ( New Caledonia , Loyalty Is), Northern Marianas, PNG (Bismarck Arch., PNG ), Rennell I., Solomon Is, Tonga , Vanuatu , Western Samoa .
